intro: Euphrasia svanica, commonly known as the Svanic eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Euphrasia svanica is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye ailments and skin conditions.
